body_html:
the error that you just printed out gives us more to work on.
It looks like you are using a openblas from conda . The environment that's worked for me does not use the openblas from conda. So this will take a little experimentation on what combination will work but try and un-install openblas from the conda environment (taking note of what might be uninstalled when uninstalling openblas). And use the openblas that comes with the OS. I also use numpy via pip. I think numpy from conda requires openblas (I think). Use the following script as reference : https://github.com/avmgithub/pytorch_builder/blob/master/refresh_image.sh
body_text:
the error that you just printed out gives us more to work on.
It looks like you are using a openblas from conda .   The environment that's worked for me does not use the openblas from conda.   So this will take a little experimentation on what combination will work but try and un-install openblas from the conda environment (taking note of what might be uninstalled when uninstalling openblas).   And use the openblas that comes with the OS.     I also use numpy via pip.    I think numpy from conda requires openblas (I think).     Use the following script as reference :  https://github.com/avmgithub/pytorch_builder/blob/master/refresh_image.sh
body:
the error that you just printed out gives us more to work on.  
It looks like you are using a openblas from conda .   The environment that's worked for me does not use the openblas from conda.   So this will take a little experimentation on what combination will work but try and un-install openblas from the conda environment (taking note of what might be uninstalled when uninstalling openblas).   And use the openblas that comes with the OS.     I also use numpy via pip.    I think numpy from conda requires openblas (I think).     Use the following script as reference :  https://github.com/avmgithub/pytorch_builder/blob/master/refresh_image.sh
